Package ca.queensu.cs.cisc124.notes.basics.geometry

Class Vector2

  • java.lang.Object
    • ca.queensu.cs.cisc124.notes.basics.geometry.Vector2
  • public class Vector2
extends Object
    A vector in 2-dimensional Cartesian space having real coordinates.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor Description
      Vector2()
      Initializes the elements of this vector to (0.0, 0.0).
      Vector2​(double x, double y)
      Initializes the coordinates of this vector to (x, y) where x and y are specified by the caller.
      Vector2​(Vector2 other)
      Initializes the coordinates of this vector by copying the coordinates from other.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Static Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method Description
      Vector2 add​(Vector2 w)
      Add a vector to this vector changing the coordinates of this vector.
      static Vector2 add​(Vector2 v, Vector2 w)
      Returns a new vector equal to v + w.
      Vector2 divide​(double s)
      Divide this vector by a scalar value changing the coordinates of this vector.
      static Vector2 divide​(double s, Vector2 v)
      Returns a new vector equal to v / s.
      double dot​(Vector2 w)
      Returns the dot product of this vector and the specified vector.
      boolean equals​(Object obj)
      Compares this vector to the specified object.
      int hashCode()
      Returns a hash code for this point computed using the coordinates of this point.
      double mag()
      Returns the magnitude (length) of this vector without intermediate overflow or underflow.
      Vector2 multiply​(double s)
      Multiply this vector by a scalar value changing the coordinates of this vector.
      static Vector2 multiply​(double s, Vector2 v)
      Returns a new vector equal to s * v.
      Vector2 negate()
      Negate the coordinates of this vector changing the coordinates of this vector.
      static Vector2 negate​(Vector2 v)
      Returns a new vector equal to -v.
      Vector2 set​(double newX, double newY)
      Sets the x and y coordinate to the specified values.
      Vector2 subtract​(Vector2 w)
      Subtract a vector from this vector changing the coordinates of this vector.
      static Vector2 subtract​(Vector2 v, Vector2 w)
      Returns a new vector equal to v - w.
      String toString()
      Returns a string representation of this vector.
      double x()
      Returns the x coordinate.
      Vector2 x​(double newX)
      Sets the x coordinate to the specified value.
      double y()
      Returns the y coordinate.
      Vector2 y​(double newY)
      Sets the y coordinate to the specified value.

      • add

        public Vector2 add​(Vector2 w)
        Add a vector to this vector changing the coordinates of this vector.

        Use this method when you want to write something like v = v + w where v is this vector and w is a second vector.

        Parameters:
        w - the vector to add
        Returns:
        a reference to this vector

        Returns:

        public Vector2 divide​(double s)
        Divide this vector by a scalar value changing the coordinates of this vector.

        Use this method when you want to write something like v = v / s where v is a vector and s is a scalar.

        Parameters:

        Returns:
        a reference to this vector
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - if s == 0.0 is true

      • equals

        public boolean equals​(Object obj)
        Compares this vector to the specified object. The result is true if and only if the argument is not null and is a Vector2 object that has the same x and y coordinates as this object.
        Overrides:
        equals in class Object
        Parameters:
        obj - the object to compare this vector against
        Returns:
        true if the given object represents a Vector2 object with the same x and y coordinates as this vector, false otherwise

      • hashCode

      • toString

        public String toString()
        Returns a string representation of this vector. The string representation are the coordinates of the vector separated by a comma and space all inside a pair of parentheses.
        Overrides:
        toString in class Object
        Returns:
        a string representation of this vector
